body:
Something is definitively wrong with your Rhino.
Here is a screenshot of 5 different "S" inputs that I used, showing different text dot font sizes: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/p-XRgTIeFsFnVGN2HMwrYRxbRUEPPC7O6w94NKI1eurxvIUfJQmuyC-Olh7yIAYNF*AEFDIFd-Ry*ScjVt4vcrtR81jlkxDt/textDots_differentFontSizes.jpg) The column on the top left has size of 14 (Rhino's default text dot font size), then 12, 10, 8 and the column on the far right 6.

Indeed when you try to print them, they all look the same: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/p-XRgTIeFsE*morC2iSeZGfX8kD7Tk7iP3aw6l4QP96OiC7MxbqGJV9FB-YPyspXK16AS4uOpF0K5PynUHRGc0eDU3MynOnM/printed_textDots_differentFontSizes.jpg) which seems to be some limitation of Rhino 5.


I attached below a new python component which will bake text instead of text dots. Rhino 5 does not have a problem with printing of their sizes.Replace it with previous text dots baking python component. The "Refresh" button should be pressed before you decide to bake
